intro: Diplycosia jiewhoei, commonly known as the Jiewhoe's diplycosia, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes approximately 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are usually elliptical and have a smooth surface, while its stems are slender and somewhat woody. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
